properties.description: Orders APIs of the Codito platform
Products APIs of the Codito platform
Shipments APIs of the Codito platform
Shipment Webhook APIs of the Codito platform
Administrators is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Microsoft Azure subscription administrators fall into this group.
Developers is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Signed-in users fall into this group.
Guests is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Unauthenticated users visiting the developer portal fall into this group.

properties.title: Subscription requests (requiring approval)

properties.value:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - Only the <forward-request> policy element can appear within the <backend> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy position the cursor at the desired insertion point and click on the round button associated with the policy.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <cors>
      <allowed-origins>
        <origin>*</origin>
      </allowed-origins>
      <allowed-methods>
        <method>*</method>
      </allowed-methods>
      <allowed-headers>
        <header>*</header>
      </allowed-headers>
      <expose-headers>
        <header>*</header>
      </expose-headers>
    </cors>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <forward-request />
  </backend>
  <outbound />
  <on-error />
</policies>

properties.description: All APIs in the Codito customer platform offering

properties.subject: Thank you for using the $OrganizationName API!
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

On behalf of $OrganizationName and our customers we thank you for giving us a try. Your $OrganizationName API account is now closed.

Thank you,

Your $OrganizationName Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Developer farewell letter
properties.description: Developers receive this farewell email after they close their account.

properties.subject: Your application $AppName is published in the application gallery
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

We are happy to let you know that your request to publish the $AppName application in the application gallery has been approved. Your application has been published and can be viewed here.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.title: Application gallery submission approved
properties.description: Developers who submitted their application for publication in the application gallery on the developer portal receive this email after their submission is approved.

properties.subject: Please confirm your new $OrganizationName API account
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Thank you for joining the $OrganizationName API program! We host a growing number of cool APIs and strive to provide an awesome experience for API developers.

First order of business is to activate your account and get you going. To that end, please click on the following link:

$ConfirmUrl

If clicking the link does not work, please copy-and-paste or re-type it into your browser's address bar and hit "Enter".

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: New developer account confirmation
properties.description: Developers receive this email to confirm their e-mail address after they sign up for a new account.

parameters.name: ConfirmQuery
parameters.title: Query string part of the activation URL

properties.subject: Please confirm the new email associated with your $OrganizationName API account
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

You are receiving this email because you made a change to the email address on your $OrganizationName API account.

Please click on the following link to confirm the change:

$ConfirmUrl

If clicking the link does not work, please copy-and-paste or re-type it into your browser's address bar and hit "Enter".

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Email change confirmation
properties.description: Developers receive this email to confirm a new e-mail address after they change their existing one associated with their account.

parameters.name: ConfirmQuery
parameters.title: Query string part of the confirmation URL

properties.subject: You are invited to join the $OrganizationName developer network
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Your account has been created. Please follow the link below to visit the $OrganizationName developer portal and claim it:

$ConfirmUrl

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.title: Invite user
properties.description: An e-mail invitation to create an account, sent on request by API publishers.

parameters.name: ConfirmQuery

properties.subject: $IssueName issue has a new comment
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

This is a brief note to let you know that $CommenterFirstName $CommenterLastName made the following comment on the issue $IssueName you created:

$CommentText

To view the issue on the developer portal click here.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.title: New comment added to an issue
properties.description: Developers receive this email when someone comments on the issue they created on the Issues page of the developer portal.

properties.subject: Welcome to the $OrganizationName API!
properties.body:
Welcome to $OrganizationName API!

Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Your $OrganizationName API program registration is completed and we are thrilled to have you as a customer. Here are a few important bits of information for your reference:

#if ($IdentityProvider == "Basic") #else #end
Please use the following username when signing into any of the ${OrganizationName}-hosted developer portals: $DevUsername Please use the following $IdentityProvider account when signing into any of the ${OrganizationName}-hosted developer portals: $DevUsername
We will direct all communications to the following email address: $DevEmail

Best of luck in your API pursuits!

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Developer welcome letter
properties.description: Developers receive this “welcome” email after they confirm their new account.

properties.subject: Your request $IssueName was received
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Thank you for contacting us. Our API team will review your issue and get back to you soon.

Click this link to view or edit your request.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.title: New issue received
properties.description: This email is sent to developers after they create a new topic on the Issues page of the developer portal.

properties.subject: Your password was reset
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

The password of your $OrganizationName API account has been reset, per your request.

Your new password is: $DevPassword

Please make sure to change it next time you sign in.

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Password reset by publisher notification (Password reset by admin)
properties.description: Developers receive this email when the publisher resets their password.

properties.subject: Your password change request
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

You are receiving this email because you requested to change the password on your $OrganizationName API account.

Please click on the link below and follow instructions to create your new password:

$ConfirmUrl

If clicking the link does not work, please copy-and-paste or re-type it into your browser's address bar and hit "Enter".

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Password change confirmation
properties.description: Developers receive this email when they request a password change of their account. The purpose of the email is to verify that the account owner made the request and to provide a one-time perishable URL for changing the password.

parameters.name: ConfirmQuery
parameters.title: Query string part of the instruction URL

properties.subject: Your subscription to the $ProdName
properties.body:
Greetings $DevFirstName $DevLastName!

Thank you for subscribing to the $ProdName and welcome to the $OrganizationName developer community. We are delighted to have you as part of the team and are looking forward to the amazing applications you will build using our API!

Below are a few subscription details for your reference:

    #if ($SubStartDate != "")
  • Start date: $SubStartDate
    • #end #if ($SubTerm != "")
  • Subscription term: $SubTerm
    • #end

Visit the developer profile area to manage your subscription and subscription keys

A couple of pointers to help get you started:

Learn about the API

The API documentation provides all information necessary to make a request and to process a response. Code samples are provided per API operation in a variety of languages. Moreover, an interactive console allows making API calls directly from the developer portal without writing any code.

Feature your app in the app gallery

You can publish your application on our gallery for increased visibility to potential new users.

Stay in touch

If you have an issue, a question, a suggestion, a request, or if you just want to tell us something, go to the Issues page on the developer portal and create a new topic.

Happy hacking,

The $OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: New subscription activated
properties.description: Developers receive this acknowledgement email after subscribing to a product.

properties.subject: You are approaching an API quota limit
properties.body:
Greetings $DevFirstName $DevLastName!

You are approaching the quota limit on you subscription to the $ProdName product (primary key $SubPrimaryKey). #if ($QuotaResetDate != "") This quota will be renewed on $QuotaResetDate. #else This quota will not be renewed. #end

Below are details on quota usage for the subscription:

#foreach ($api in $Apis) #foreach ($operation in $api.Operations) #end #end
Quota Scope Calls Call Quota Bandwidth Bandwidth Quota
Subscription #if ($CallsAlert == true) $Calls #else $Calls #end $CallQuota #if ($BandwidthAlert == true) $Bandwidth #else $Bandwidth #end $BandwidthQuota
API: $api.Name #if ($api.CallsAlert == true) $api.Calls #else $api.Calls #end $api.CallQuota #if ($api.BandwidthAlert == true) $api.Bandwidth #else $api.Bandwidth #end $api.BandwidthQuota
Operation: $operation.Name #if ($operation.CallsAlert == true) $operation.Calls #else $operation.Calls #end $operation.CallQuota #if ($operation.BandwidthAlert == true) $operation.Bandwidth #else $operation.Bandwidth #end $operation.BandwidthQuota

Thank you,

$OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Developer quota limit approaching notification
properties.description: Developers receive this email to alert them when they are approaching a quota limit.

properties.subject: Your subscription request for the $ProdName
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

We would like to inform you that we reviewed your subscription request for the $ProdName.

#if ($SubDeclineReason == "")

Regretfully, we were unable to approve it, as subscriptions are temporarily suspended at this time.

#else

Regretfully, we were unable to approve it at this time for the following reason:

$SubDeclineReason

#end

We truly appreciate your interest.

All the best,

The $OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Subscription request declined
properties.description: This email is sent to developers when their subscription requests for products requiring publisher approval is declined.

properties.subject: Your subscription request for the $ProdName
properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Thank you for your interest in our $ProdName API product!

We were delighted to receive your subscription request. We will promptly review it and get back to you at $DevEmail.

Thank you,

The $OrganizationName API Team

$DevPortalUrl
properties.title: Subscription request received
properties.description: This email is sent to developers to acknowledge receipt of their subscription requests for products requiring publisher approval.

properties.DisplayName: All Computers with their most recent data
properties.Query:
search not(ObjectName == "Advisor Metrics" or ObjectName == "ManagedSpace") | summarize AggregatedValue = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer | limit 500000 | sort by Computer asc
// Oql: NOT(ObjectName="Advisor Metrics" OR ObjectName=ManagedSpace) | measure max(TimeGenerated) by Computer | top 500000 | Sort Computer // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Which Management Group is generating the most data points?
properties.Query:
search * | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by ManagementGroupName
// Oql: * | Measure count() by ManagementGroupName // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Distribution of data Types
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Type
// Oql: * | Measure count() by Type // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Stale Computers (data older than 24 hours)
properties.Query:
search not(ObjectName == "Advisor Metrics" or ObjectName == "ManagedSpace") | summarize lastdata = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer | limit 500000 | where lastdata < ago(24h)
// Oql: NOT(ObjectName="Advisor Metrics" OR ObjectName=ManagedSpace) | measure max(TimeGenerated) as lastdata by Computer | top 500000 | where lastdata < NOW-24HOURS // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All Events
properties.Query:
Event | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All Syslogs
properties.Query:
Syslog | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Syslog // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All Syslog Records grouped by Facility
properties.Query:
Syslog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Facility
// Oql: Type=Syslog | Measure count() by Facility // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All Syslog Records grouped by ProcessName
properties.Query:
Syslog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by ProcessName
// Oql: Type=Syslog | Measure count() by ProcessName // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All Syslog Records with Errors
properties.Query:
Syslog | where SeverityLevel == "error" | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Syslog SeverityLevel=error // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Average HTTP Request time by Client IP Address
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = avg(TimeTaken) by cIP
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Avg(TimeTaken) by cIP // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Average HTTP Request time by HTTP Method
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = avg(TimeTaken) by csMethod
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Avg(TimeTaken) by csMethod // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of IIS Log Entries by Client IP Address
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by cIP
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure count() by cIP // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of IIS Log Entries by HTTP Request Method
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csMethod
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure count() by csMethod // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of IIS Log Entries by HTTP User Agent
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csUserAgent
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure count() by csUserAgent // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of IIS Log Entries by Host requested by client
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csHost
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure count() by csHost // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of IIS Log Entries by URL for the host "www.contoso.com" (replace with your own)
properties.Query:
search csHost == "www.contoso.com" | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csUriStem
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog csHost="www.contoso.com" | Measure count() by csUriStem // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of IIS Log Entries by URL requested by client (without query strings)
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csUriStem
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure count() by csUriStem // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of Events with level "Warning" grouped by Event ID
properties.Query:
Event | where EventLevelName == "warning" | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by EventID
// Oql: Type=Event EventLevelName=warning | Measure count() by EventID // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Shows breakdown of response codes
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by scStatus
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure count() by scStatus // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of Events grouped by Event Log
properties.Query:
Event | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by EventLog
// Oql: Type=Event | Measure count() by EventLog // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of Events grouped by Event ID
properties.Query:
Event | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by EventID
// Oql: Type=Event | Measure count() by EventID // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of Events grouped by Event Source
properties.Query:
Event | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Source
// Oql: Type=Event | Measure count() by Source // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Events in the Operations Manager Event Log whose Event ID is in the range between 2000 and 3000
properties.Query:
Event | where EventLog == "Operations Manager" and EventID >= 2000 and EventID <= 3000 | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventLog="Operations Manager" EventID:[2000..3000] // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Count of Events containing the word "started" grouped by EventID
properties.Query:
search in (Event) "started" | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by EventID
// Oql: Type=Event "started" | Measure count() by EventID // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Find the maximum time taken for each page
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = max(TimeTaken) by csUriStem
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Max(TimeTaken) by csUriStem // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: IIS Log Entries for a specific client IP Address (replace with your own)
properties.Query:
search cIP == "192.168.0.1" | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | sort by TimeGenerated desc | project csUriStem, scBytes, csBytes, TimeTaken, scStatus
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog cIP="192.168.0.1" | Select csUriStem,scBytes,csBytes,TimeTaken,scStatus // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All IIS Log Entries
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: How many connections to Operations Manager's SDK service by day
properties.Query:
Event | where EventID == 26328 and EventLog == "Operations Manager" | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d) | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventID=26328 EventLog="Operations Manager" | Measure count() interval 1DAY // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: When did my servers initiate restart?
properties.Query:
search in (Event) "shutdown" and EventLog == "System" and Source == "User32" and EventID == 1074 | sort by TimeGenerated desc | project TimeGenerated, Computer
// Oql: shutdown Type=Event EventLog=System Source=User32 EventID=1074 | Select TimeGenerated,Computer // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Shows which pages people are getting a 404 for
properties.Query:
search scStatus == 404 | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by csUriStem
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog scStatus=404 | Measure count() by csUriStem // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Shows servers that are throwing internal server error
properties.Query:
search scStatus == 500 | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by sComputerName
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog scStatus=500 | Measure count() by sComputerName // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Total Bytes received by each Azure Role Instance
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = sum(csBytes) by RoleInstance
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Sum(csBytes) by RoleInstance // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Total Bytes received by each IIS Computer
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = sum(csBytes) by Computer | limit 500000
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Sum(csBytes) by Computer | top 500000 // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Total Bytes responded back to clients by Client IP Address
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = sum(scBytes) by cIP
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Sum(scBytes) by cIP // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Total Bytes responded back to clients by each IIS ServerIP Address
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = sum(scBytes) by sIP
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Sum(scBytes) by sIP // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Total Bytes sent by Client IP Address
properties.Query:
search * | extend Type = $table | where Type == W3CIISLog | summarize AggregatedValue = sum(csBytes) by cIP
// Oql: Type=W3CIISLog | Measure Sum(csBytes) by cIP // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PEF: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: All Events with level "Warning"
properties.Query:
Event | where EventLevelName == "warning" | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventLevelName=warning // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: Windows Firewall Policy settings have changed
properties.Query:
Event | where EventLog == "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" and EventID == 2008 | sort by TimeGenerated desc
// Oql: Type=Event EventLog="Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" EventID=2008 // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.DisplayName: On which machines and how many times have Windows Firewall Policy settings changed
properties.Query:
Event | where EventLog == "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" and EventID == 2008 | summarize AggregatedValue = count() by Computer | limit 500000
// Oql: Type=Event EventLog="Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security/Firewall" EventID=2008 | measure count() by Computer | top 500000 // Args: {OQ: True; WorkspaceId: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} // Settings: {PTT: True; SortI: True; SortF: True} // Version: 0.1.122

properties.value:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    Traffic routing is based on official sample:
        https://github.com/Azure/api-management-policy-snippets/blob/master/examples/Random%20load%20balancer.policy.xml
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
    <set-variable name="urlId" value="@(new Random(context.RequestId.GetHashCode()).Next(1, 3))" />
    <choose>
      <when condition="@(context.Variables.GetValueOrDefault<int>("urlId") == 1)">
        <!-- Use default host -->
      </when>
      <when condition="@(context.Variables.GetValueOrDefault<int>("urlId") == 2)">
        <set-backend-service base-url="https://microservices-with-apim-services-products.azurewebsites.net" />
      </when>
      <otherwise>
        <return-response>
          <set-status code="500" reason="InternalServerError" />
          <set-header name="Microsoft-Azure-Api-Management-Correlation-Id" exists-action="override">
            <value>@{return Guid.NewGuid().ToString();}</value>
          </set-header>
          <set-body>A gateway-related error occurred while processing the request.</set-body>
        </return-response>
      </otherwise>
    </choose>
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
    <choose>
      <when condition="@(context.Variables.GetValueOrDefault<int>("urlId") == 1)">
        <set-header name="X-Runtime" exists-action="override">
          <value>Legacy</value>
        </set-header>
      </when>
      <when condition="@(context.Variables.GetValueOrDefault<int>("urlId") == 2)">
        <set-header name="X-Runtime" exists-action="override">
          <value>Experiment (App Services with Containers)</value>
        </set-header>
      </when>
      <otherwise />
    </choose>
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound>
    <base />
  </inbound>
  <backend>
    <base />
  </backend>
  <outbound>
    <base />
  </outbound>
  <on-error>
    <base />
  </on-error>
</policies>

<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>

    <base />
  </backend>

Administrators is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Microsoft Azure subscription administrators fall into this group.
Administrators is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Microsoft Azure subscription administrators fall into this group.
Developers is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Signed-in users fall into this group.
Guests is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Unauthenticated users visiting the developer portal fall into this group.
